revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2014}} {{Use British English|date=February 2014}} The following is a list of late night, DVD and spin-off series of [[Channel 4]] [[soap-opera]] ''[[Hollyoaks]]''. Each has a brief summary of the plot. ==Video/DVD specials== ===Hollyoaks: Off on One=== A video spin-off from 1998 which sees [[Rob Hawthorne (Hollyoaks)|Rob Hawthorne]] seek revenge against [[Kurt Benson]]. The storyline comes to a dramatic conclusion with Rob and Kurt fighting on a boat. Rob rushes at Kurt, however he moves out of the way and Rob falls into the sea, with everyone believing he is dead. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Indecent Behaviour=== A video/DVD spin-off released in 2001. [[Geri Hudson]] arrives with footballer boyfriend [[Jason Cunliffe (Hollyoaks)|Jason Cunliffe]]. In a club, [[Scott Anderson (Hollyoaks)|Scott Anderson]] begins to chat Geri up. [[Luke Morgan]] steps in to stop him taking it too far, however just as Scott and his friends are about to throw Luke into the river, Scott tells his friends that he has a better idea; Scott and his friends pull Luke's trousers down to make fun of Luke's rape from the previous year. [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]] and [[Beth Morgan (Hollyoaks)|Beth Morgan]] try to break Scott and Luke up before a fight breaks, which it does between Ben and Luke. Beth is later offered a lift by Scott, and then is raped. {{-}} ==Late night specials== ===Hollyoaks: Lost Weekend=== Four episodes broadcast in 1999 centring around the kidnapping of [[Lucy Benson]] by Rob Hawthorne and the desperate search by [[Ruth Osborne]], [[Lewis Richardson (Hollyoaks)|Lewis Richardson]] and [[Tony Hutchinson]]. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Boys Do Barca=== Broadcast in 2000, [[Alex Bell (Hollyoaks)|Alex Bell]], [[Max Cunningham]], [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]], [[Tony Hutchinson]], [[Luke Morgan]], [[Sam "O.B." O'Brien]], [[Sol Patrick]] and [[Lewis Richardson (Hollyoaks)|Lewis Richardson]] make their way to [[Barcelona]] to celebrate [[Rory Finnigan]]'s stag party before Finn marries Tony's Mother. Tony, however, has secretly enlisted the help of [[Carol Groves]] to convince Finn not to go ahead with the marriage. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Breaking Boundaries=== Broadcast in March 2000, the late night special involves a 90s disco at the club where [[Ruth Osborne]] discovers [[Lewis Richardson (Hollyoaks)|Lewis Richardson's]] gambling addiction. Ruth and Lewis eventually end up sleeping together, despite Ruth's marriage to [[Kurt Benson]]. Meanwhile, after a football match, [[Mark Gibbs]] beats up [[Luke Morgan]] before raping him. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Leap of Faith=== The 2003 late night special sees [[Ellie Mills]] try to kill herself before telling serial-killer husband [[Toby Mills|Toby]] to hand himself in to the police. Toby realises he could not live without Ellie and ends up holding her hostage on a rooftop. As Toby prepares to jump with Ellie, [[Dan Hunter]] arrives and pushes Toby off the building, killing him. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: After Hours=== A four-part late night series broadcast in 2004. [[Lisa Hunter]] is whisked away to Paris with a man she meets in a hotel where she worked. [[Joe Spencer (Hollyoaks)|Joe Spencer]] and his friends go on a night out that ends in disaster. Meanwhile, former character [[Matt Musgrove]] crosses over to the special. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: In Too Deep=== In a one off special aired on 31 May 2005, [[Steph Dean]] is haunted by the ghost of one of [[Toby Mills]]' victims and she nearly drowns. Meanwhile [[Lee Hunter (Hollyoaks)|Lee Hunter]] and Bombhead cause mayhem at the backstage of Steph's show. {{-}} '''Cast:''' {| class="wikitable" |- ! Character ! Actor |- | [[Bombhead]] | [[Lee Otway]] |- | [[Cameron Clark]] | Ben Gerrard |- | [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]] | [[Marcus Patric]] |- | [[Craig Dean]] | [[Guy Burnett]] |- | [[Frankie Osborne|Frankie Dean]] | [[Helen Pearson]] |- | [[Steph Dean]] | [[Carley Stenson]] |- | [[Lee Hunter]] | [[Alex Carter (British actor)|Alex Carter]] |- | [[Lisa Hunter]] | [[Gemma Atkinson]] |- | [[Joe Spencer (Hollyoaks)|Joe Spencer]] | Matt Milburn |- | Lucy | [[Celena Cherry]] |- | Michelle | Lou Emmett |- | Simon | Sean Taylor |- | Vanessa | Lizzie Hills |} ===Hollyoaks: Crossing the Line=== The late night special broadcast in 2005 sees [[Andy Holt (Hollyoaks)|Andy Holt]] spike [[Dannii Carbone]]'s drink with [[gamma-Hydroxybutyric acid|GHB]] before raping her. Andy then reveals his activities to his friend, [[Sam Owen]], who agrees to join Andy to drug and rape girls. Meanwhile Chris tricks [[Lee Hunter (Hollyoaks)|Lee Hunter]] into sleeping with a transvestite called Aphrodite. Elsewhere, [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]] and [[Lisa Hunter]] make friends with siblings Ally and Alex. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: No Going Back=== ssssFollowing ''Crossing the Line'', [[Andy Holt (Hollyoaks)|Andy]] drugs [[Sophie Burton|Sophie]] and [[Mel Burton]]. He rapes Mel and leaves [[Sam Owen|Sam]] to rape Sophie, but he does not. Dannii tells [[Russ Owen]] that she was raped. He does not believe her so she attempts suicide. Mel, Sophie and [[Louise Summers]] stop her and report Andy to the police. Sam and Andy, both on the top of a cliff, are caught in a fight between themselves and Russ. Sam and Andy both fall over the cliff. Russ manages to grab the pair, however has to let one go, so lets Andy fall to his death. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Back from the Dead=== In 2006, Andy Holt returns after surviving the fall and seeks his revenge against Russ by kidnapping his sister [[Nicole Owen|Nicole]]. Sam and Russ come in to free Nicole but Andy attacks them with a metal pole and threatens to rape Nicole but then Mel bursts in and whacks him over the head with the metal pole and begins to laugh at him as she calls the police. Whilst tied up, Andy let's slip to Russ and Nicole about Sam's involvement in the rapes. Andy escapes, and Mel chases after him and he runs into a metal spike and he starts to bleed from his mouth, he starts to talk but Mel can't understand what he said, maybe it was sorry! He then dies a painful death causing celebrations round Chester to those he raped{{-}} ===Hollyoaks: King of Hearts=== A late night special called ''Hollyoaks: King of Hearts'' was announced in November 2010 and was broadcast on 15 December 2010 on Channel 4.{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a287673/hollyoaks-confirms-late-night-special.html |title=Hollyoaks confirms late-night special |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi Médias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]) |first=Daniel |last=Kilkelly |accessdate=2010-11-14 |date=14 November 2010}} The episode followed events in the main series which saw [[Kathleen McQueen]] blackmailing her family. The episode features [[Rhys Ashworth]] and [[Jacqui McQueen]] attempting to cheat during a game of poker with [[Brendan Brady]] and [[Danny Houston]]. After their plan is discovered, Danny tells Jacqui she must sleep with him to save Rhys and wipe the debt they owe him. The episode was originally due to air on 16 December 2010. However, this was later changed.{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/scoop/a289629/schedule-change-for-hollyoaks-special.html |title=Schedule change for Hollyoaks special |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi Médias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]) |first=Daniel |last=Kilkelly |date=24 November |accessdate=2010-11-24}} {{-}} ==Spin-off series== ===Hollyoaks: Movin' On=== A new sixteen part series. [[Tony Hutchinson]] and [[Rory Finnigan]] open their new business venture. Meanwhile, after beating [[Ruth Osborne]] up, [[Lewis Richardson (Hollyoaks)|Lewis]], racked by guilt, commits suicide. Ruth then leaves for [[London]]. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Let Loose=== A 2005 series following [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]] and [[Lisa Hunter]] as they depart Hollyoaks for a new life. Lisa and Ben's relationship is put to the test over Lisa's jealousy, however she agrees to give their relationship another go. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: In the City=== {{main|Hollyoaks: In the City}} Lisa and Ben return to [[Liverpool]], where Lisa is set up with a modelling agency. Ben spends the pair's entire savings on a bar. Lisa delves further up the career path and Ben has an illicit affair and is involved in dodgy dealings with Burton Phillips. Finally, Lisa ended up shooting and killing Ben. ===Hollyoaks Later=== {{main|Hollyoaks Later}} {{main|Hollyoaks Later (series 1)}} 2008 series following [[Niall Rafferty]] as he returns for revenge on [[Steph Cunningham]], [[Craig Dean]] and [[Tom Cunningham]], which leads to the dramatic death of Niall. Meanwhile [[Kris Fisher|Kris]] and [[Malachy Fisher]] return to Ireland to attend their father's funeral as Malachy and [[Mercedes McQueen]] marry. [[Sarah Barnes]], [[Nancy Hayton]] and [[Zoe Carpenter]] head off on a "girly" road trip as the Dirty Diegos enter 'Battle of the Bands'.{{ cite news | url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a134073/late-night-hollyoaks-to-get-c4-run.html | title='Late Night Hollyoaks' to get C4 run | first=Kris |last=Green | publisher=[[Digital Spy]] | date=30 October 2008 | accessdate=2008-10-30 }} {{main|Hollyoaks Later (series 2)}} A second series was commissioned and was broadcast in September 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/H/hollyoaks/news/previous/09/07/090702.html |title=Hollyoaks Later To Return |publisher=Channel 4 |date=2 July 2009 |accessdate=2009-07-03}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{ cite news| url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a153128/kirkwood-to-head-up-new-hollyoaks-later.html| title=Kirkwood to produce new Hollyoaks Later | publisher=Digital Spy |first=Kris |last=Green| date=17 April 2009 | accessdate=2009-04-17 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/H/hollyoaks/news/previous/09/04/090417pm.html |title=Hollyoaks Later returns! |publisher=Channel4 |date=17 April 2009 |accessdate=2009-07-03}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} It follows four main stories: [[Hannah Ashworth|Hannah]], [[Rhys Ashworth|Rhys]] and [[Josh Ashworth]] go off to a music festival, where they encounter a dangerous drug dealer, [[Tony Hutchinson]] marries [[Cindy Cunningham]] after several mishaps, [[McQueen family|the McQueens]] go to London for [[Theresa McQueen|Theresa's]] modelling and [[Sarah Barnes]] and [[Zoe Carpenter]] are joined by Sarah's jealous girlfriend [[Lydia Hart]] on a parachute jump which leads to Sarah's death after Lydia sabotages her parachute. {{main|Hollyoaks Later (series 3)}} In April 2010, Channel 4 announced that the show would return for a third series, this time produced by Hollyoaks series producer Paul Marquess. The characters appearing included: [[Mitzeee Minniver]], [[Carl Costello]], [[Riley Costello]], [[Seth Costello]], [[Malachy Fisher]], [[Mercedes Fisher]], [[Theresa McQueen]] and [[Nancy Hayton]]. Filming took place in the summer of 2010, and in October 2010, it was revealed that the third series would begin on 25 October, and would closely interweave with the main Hollyoaks series, revolving around "one fateful night". UFC Fighter Michael Bisping guest starred. {{main|Hollyoaks Later (series 4)}} It Was reported that a fourth series had been recommissioned due to the popularity of the last few series. Filming will take place in the summer of 2011. Characters rumoured to be involved in the storylines have included [[Mercedes McQueen]], [[Myra McQueen]], [[Michaela McQueen]], [[Texas Longford]], [[Silas Blissett]], [[Heidi Costello]], [[Riley Costello]], [[Lynsey Nolan]] and [[Mitzeee Minniver]]. New cast members include a new addition to the McQueen family played by Amy Walsh sister of Girls aloud star Kimberly Walsh and a new unnamed hunk to be played by ex-eastenders actor Chris Coghill. By early June scenes had begun filming in Ibiza with Mercedes McQueen, Myra McQueen, Michaela McQueen, [[Theresa McQueen]], [[Will Savage]], [[Rae Wilson]] and Mitzeee Minniver. Series 4 is set to be aired over the course of five nights from 5 September to 10 September 2011. In the gripping final episode of the series, Rae Wilson was strangled by Silas Blissett after he heard that [[Brendan Brady]] wanted to kill her. He wanted Brendan to be arrested on suspicion of murder so that he could continue with his evil plans. {{-}} ==Online spin-offs== ===Hollyoaks: The Morning After the Night Before=== {{main|Hollyoaks: The Morning After the Night Before}} [[Josh Ashworth]] heads off to party with [[Dave Colburn]] in [[Manchester]] in the on-line spin-off which features the down side to [[binge drinking]].{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a159587/online-oaks-to-explore-binge-drinking.html |title=Online 'Oaks to explore binge drinking |publisher=Digital Spy|first=Kris|last=Green |date=12 June 2009|accessdate=2009-11-09}}{{cite news|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/H/hollyoaks/news/previous/09/06/090608.html |title=Hollyoaks: The Morning After the Night Before |publisher=Channel 4 |date=8 June 2009|accessdate=2009-11-09}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} ===Hollyoaks: Freshers=== Freshers is an 2010 online drama following the lives of the fresher students before they begin at Hollyoaks Community College. Like ''The Morning After the Night Before'', several characters' social networking websites were created. This time using [[Facebook]]. The series featured the return of [[Lee Hunter]], and debut of new characters [[Jamil Fadel]], [[Leanne Holiday]] and [[Doug Carter]]. It also starred [[Charlotte Lau]], [[India Longford]], [[Texas Longford]] and [[Dave Colburn]]. A return also featured [[David "Bombhead" Burke|Bombhead]]. ==Media Content== ===Hollyoaks: Access All Areas=== {{-}} ===Hollyoaks on the Pull=== {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Extreme Challenges=== {{-}} ===Hollyoaks Backstage=== An on-line documentary featuring various members of the ''Hollyoaks'' cast showing viewers behind the scenes of the show. Each 3 minute episode is shown broadcast weekly on the E4 website. {{-}} ===''The Hollyoaks Music Show''=== {{Infobox television | show_name = The Hollyoaks Music Show | italic_title = no | format = [[Music]] | language = English | num_episodes = 26 | presenter = [[Rick Edwards]] (2008–2010)
[[Matt Littler]] (2011) | producer = Sarah Clarke | director = Chris Howe
Dave Skinner | company = Conker Media
[[Lime Pictures]] | runtime = 30 minutes | website = http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/ | production_website =http://www.limepictures.com/MusicShow.htm }} '''''The Hollyoaks Music Show''''' is a music television programme broadcast as part of [[T4 (Channel 4)|T4]] on [[Channel 4]]. The show began broadcasting on 17 October 2009, following a pilot episode in 2008, and features various recording artists performing and participating in the show. It is sponsored by British retailer [[Matalan]] and hosted by [[Rick Edwards]]. The series first began in 2008, when it was named ''Hollyoaks Music Special'', a one-off programme hosted by [[Rick Edwards]] and former ''Hollyoaks'' actor [[Matt Littler]].{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a91635/hollyoaks-to-host-music-special.html |title='Hollyoaks' to host 'Music Special' |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi Médias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]) |first=Dave |last=West |date=15 March 2008 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} Following its success, Channel 4 commissioned two series{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a96807/c4-wants-hollyoaks-music-show-series.html |title=C4 wants 'Hollyoaks Music Show' series |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi Médias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]) |first=Dave |last=West |date=15 March 2008 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} and retailer [[Matalan]] became the show's official sponsor, in order to reach the target audience of 16 to 34 year olds. Repeats of the series have been shown on [[4Music]] since 2010.{{cite web |url=http://www.4music.com/article/ontv/the-hollyoaks-music-show-2010-06-05.html |title=The Hollyoaks Music Show |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20 |work=[[4Music]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]])}} In 2009 the first series aired, retitled ''The Hollyoaks Music Show''. When the new series was broadcast, it was shown as part of T4 weekly on Channel 4, again presented by Rick Edwards. It is filmed within the ''Hollyoaks'' studios in [[Childwall]], [[Liverpool]]. The show features signed and unsigned acts performing in and around the ''Hollyoaks'' set. A Christmas special was announced in November 2010, due to air in December.{{cite web |url=http://www.e4.com/blog/hollyoaks/post/ajeki0bif2jxepkisgcz9n/view.e4 |title=Music Show with Matalan.co.uk - Xmas Special |work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |first=Ciaran |last=Varley |date=23 November 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-24}} Acts which have appeared include [[The Saturdays]],{{cite web|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/interviews/thesaturdays.html|title=Saturdays To Disband For S Club Juniors Reunion?|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |date=20 October 2009|accessdate=2009-10-20}} [[Mr Hudson]],{{cite web|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/interviews/mrhudson.html|title=Mr Hudson Was Laughed At By Rihanna Shocker...|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |date=20 October 2009|accessdate=2009-10-20}} [[Chipmunk (rapper)|Chipmunk]],{{cite web|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/interviews/chipmunk.html|title=Chipmunk's Critical Thinking...|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |date=20 October 2009|accessdate=2009-10-20}} [[Tinchy Stryder]], [[N-Dubz]] and [[Calvin Harris]], [[Example (rapper)|Example]], [[Jason Derulo]],{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/blog/week07/index.shtml |title=Show Seven: Riding Solo |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |year=2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} [[Diana Vickers]], [[Olly Murs]], [[The Wanted]] and [[You Me at Six]] as well as some unsigned acts including Minnie Londoner{{cite web |url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/enter/ |title=Holypops - The Hollyoaks Music Show |work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |year=2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} and The Palpitations.{{cite web |url=http://www.thepalpitations.co.uk/hollyoaks-music/ |title=Hollyoaks Music |work=The Palpitations |publisher=(thepalpitations.co.uk) |date=24 May 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} The show regularly features members of the ''Hollyoaks'' cast as part of the audience.{{cite web|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/about.html|title=About The Hollyoaks Music Show|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |date=20 October 2009|accessdate=2009-10-20}} Along with the performances, ''The Hollyoaks Music Show'' also features fashion awards in each episode from episode 11 onwards. The award is presented to an act from the same episode for their clothing style. Acts who won the award include Olly Murs, [[Rihanna]], [[Selena Gomez]], [[McFly]] and [[JLS]].{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/fashionaward/ |title=This Week's Fashion Award |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |date=11 June 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} A competition was run online throughout the series, with the winner given the chance to appear performing in an episode of ''Hollyoaks''.{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/hollypops/ |title=Hollypops |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |year= 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} The winner was Shide Boss.{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/hollypops/week04/ |title=Show Four - Shide Boss |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |date=12 June 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}}{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/exclusivevideo/ |title=Exclusive: Shide Boss on set |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |year=2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} {{-}} ==Other related shows== ===Hollyoaks: The Good, the Bad and the Gorgeous=== A drama-documentary shown on [[E4 (channel)|E4]] on 2 October 2009.{{cite news|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/H/hollyoaks/news/previous/09/09/090914.html|title=Hollyoaks: The Good, the Bad and the Gorgeous|publisher=Channel 4|date=14 September 2009|accessdate=2009-09-14}} [[Ste Hay]] and [[Cheryl Brady]] go to a cinema where old clips from ''Hollyoaks'' are being shown by a familiar face. It was presented by Bernard Latham who played [[Gordon Cunningham]]. For the episode, special sequences were filmed between old clips of the show. They parodied such films as [[Stanley Kubrick]]'s ''[[The Shining (film)|The Shining]]'' and [[Randal Kleiser]]'s ''[[Grease (film)|Grease]]''. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks Best Bits 2011=== ===Hollyoaks: A Little Film About Love=== A special [[E4 (TV channel)|E4]] only episode which aired on 11 November 2011 following characters [[Jason Costello]] and [[Bart McQueen]] travelling to London to stop [[Sinead O'Connor (Hollyoaks)|Sinead O'Connor]] from leaving with boyfriend [[Gaz Bennett]], during the journey Jason records on a camera as documentary, it also features pre-recorded clips of Jason interviewing characters such as [[Maddie Morrison]], [[Neil Cooper (Hollyoaks)|Neil Cooper]] and [[Lynsey Nolan]]. It also features [[Jono (Hollyoaks)|Jono]], [[Nancy Hayton]], [[Tilly Evans]], [[Scott Sabeka]], [[Darren Osborne]], [[Duncan Button]] and [[Diane O'Connor]].http://www.digitalspy.ie/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/spoilers/a348178/a-little-film-about-love-by-jason-costello.html ===Hollyoaks: Chasing Rainbows=== A Special E4 only episode which aired on 7 June 2012, that follows [[Dennis Savage]] on his journey with students [[Leanne Holiday]], [[Barney Harper-McBride]] and [[Scott Sabeka]] who travel to Liverpool to seek out musician [[Maverick Sabre]] to headline the Savage's Forest Party back in the village, Dennis struggles to prove throughout that he knows Maverick and will be able to find him in time for the party.http://www.digitalspy.ie/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/spoilers/a382560/chasing-rainbows.html ===Tom's Life=== ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/index.html The official ''Hollyoaks'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/the-morning-after-the-night-before/ The official ''Hollyoaks: The Morning After the Night Before'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/tgtbtg/index.html The official ''Hollyoaks: The Good, the Bad and the Gorgeous'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/later/2009/ The official ''Hollyoaks Later'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/ The official ''Hollyoaks Music Show'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/freshers/index.html The official ''Hollyoaks Freshers'' website] {{Hollyoaks}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''Hollyoaks'' spin-offs}} {{DEFAULTSORT:List Of Hollyoaks Spin-Offs}} [[Category:Lists of soap opera episodes|Hollyoaks]] [[Category:Hollyoaks spin-offs]]

revision.comment: Added fields to thepeerage.com citations -- it is not a [[WP:SOURCE|reliable source]]) and other fixes, replaced: *[http://www.thepeerage.com/ www.thepeerage.com] → *{{cite web |last=Lundy |first=Darryl |url=http://www.th using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
The '''Bridges Baronetcy''', of Goodnestone in the County of Kent, was created in the [[Baronetage of Great Britain]] on 19 April 1718 for Brook Bridges. His son the second Baronet, died in 1733 whilst in office as [[High Sheriff of Kent]]. His grandson, the third Baronet, represented [[Kent (UK Parliament constituency)|Kent]] in the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]]. In 1842, the fifth Baronet (the grandson of the third Baronet), unsuccessfully claimed the ancient [[Baron FitzWalter|barony of FitzWalter]] (which had been in [[abeyance]] since 1756) as a descendant of Mary, sister of the seventeenth Baron FitzWalter. He later sat as a [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Kent East (UK Parliament constituency)|Kent East]]. In 1868 he was created '''Baron FitzWalter''', of Woodham Walter in the County of Essex, in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. However, the peerage became extinct on his death, while he was succeeded in the baronetcy by his younger brother, the sixth Baronet. On his death the title passed to his first cousin, the seventh Baronet. He was the son of Reverend Brook Henry Bridges, third son of the third Baronet. When he died this line of the family also failed and the title was passed on to his first cousin, the eighth Baronet. He was the son of Reverend Brook Edward Bridges, fourth son of the third Baronet. He never married and on his death in 1899 the baronetcy became extinct.
The seat of the Bridges family was [[Goodnestone, Dover|Goodnestone Park]] in [[Kent]]. The house was built in 1704 by the first Bridges Baronet. After the death of the last Baronet in 1899 the house came into the Plumptre family through the marriage of Eleanor Bridges, daughter of the fourth Bridges Baronet, to Reverend Henry Western Plumptre. In 1924 the abeyance of the barony of FitzWalter was terminated in favour of the latter's grandson, John Bridges Plumptre.
==Bridges baronets, of Goodneston (1718)== *Sir [[Brook Bridges, 1st Baronet]] (1679–1728) *Sir [[Brook Bridges, 2nd Baronet]] (1709–1733) *[[Sir Brook Bridges, 3rd Baronet|Sir Brook William Bridges, 3rd Baronet]] (1733–1791) *Sir Brook William Bridges, 4th Baronet (1767–1829) *[[Brook Bridges, 1st Baron FitzWalter|Sir Brook William Bridges, 5th Baronet]] (1801–1875) (created '''Baron FitzWalter''' in 1868)
==Barons FitzWalter (1868)== *[[Brook William Bridges, 1st Baron FitzWalter]] (1801–1875)
==Bridges baronets, of Goodneston (1718; Reverted)== *Sir Brook George Bridges, 6th Baronet (1802–1890) *Sir Thomas Pym Bridges, 7th Baronet (1805–1895) *Sir George Talbot Bridges, 8th Baronet (1818–1899)
==See also== *[[Baron FitzWalter]]
==External links== *[http://www.goodnestoneparkgardens.co.uk/ Goodnestone Park]
==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990. *[http://www.leighrayment.com/Baronetage.htm Leigh Rayment' s baronetage page] *{{cite web |last=Lundy |first=Darryl |url=http://www.thepeerage.com/info.htm |title=FAQ |publisher=[http://www.thepeerage.com The Peerage]}}{{Verify credibility|failed=y |date=February 2013}}<!--Lundy is not a reliable source so cite Lundy's reliable source See [[WP:SAYWHEREYOUREADIT]]-->
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bridges}} [[Category:Baronetcies]] [[Category:Extinct baronetcies]]

{{Infobox NFL player |name=Trent Edwards |image=Trent Edwards 2012.jpg |image_size= |caption=Edwards in November 2012. |currentteam=Free agent |currentnumber=-- |currentposition=Quarterback |birth_date={{birth date and age|1983|10|30}} |birth_place=[[Los Gatos, California]] |death_date= |death_place= |heightft=6 |heightin=4 |weight=230 |highschool=[[Los Gatos High School|Los Gatos (CA)]] |college=[[Stanford Cardinal football|Stanford]] |draftyear=2007 |draftround=3 |draftpick=92 |debutyear=2007 |debutteam=Buffalo Bills |finalyear= |finalteam= |pastteams=<nowiki></nowiki> *[[Buffalo Bills]] ({{NFL Year|2007}}–{{NFL Year|2010}}) *[[Jacksonville Jaguars]] ({{NFL Year|2010}}) *[[Oakland Raiders]] ({{NFL Year|2011}})* *[[Philadelphia Eagles]] ({{NFL Year|2012}}) *[[Chicago Bears]] ({{NFL Year|2013}})* *[[Oakland Raiders]] ({{NFL Year|2014}})* :<small>*Offseason and/or practice squad member only</small> |highlights=<nowiki></nowiki> *''[[Sporting News]]'' Freshman All-[[Pacific-10 Conference|Pac-10]] (2003) *Stanford Cardinal Team MVP (2005) *[[San Jose Mercury News]] South Bay Sports POY (2007) *Pepsi NFL Rookie Of The Week (Weeks 13,14) *NFL All-Rookie Team 2007 |statweek= |statseason=2013 |statlabel1=[[Touchdown|TD]]–[[Interception|INT]] |statvalue1=26–30 |statlabel2=Passing yards |statvalue2=6,033 |statlabel3=[[Passer rating|QB Rating]] |statvalue3=75.5 |nflnew=trentedwards/2507189 |pfr=EdwaTr01 }} '''Trent Addison Edwards''' (born October 30, 1983) is an [[American football]] [[quarterback]] who is currently a [[free agent]]. He played [[college football]] at [[Stanford Cardinal football|Stanford]] and was drafted by the [[Buffalo Bills]] in the third round of the [[2007 NFL Draft]].
He has also been a member of the [[Jacksonville Jaguars]], [[Oakland Raiders]], [[Philadelphia Eagles]] and [[Chicago Bears]].
==Early years== Edwards was a highly rated recruit from [[Los Gatos High School]] and was ranked as the #1 pro-style quarterback by ''[[USA Today]]'' in 2001.<ref name="USAToday">{{cite news|last=Emfinger|first=Max|title=A midsummer look: A dandy dozen quarterbacks|work=USA Today|date=July 18, 2001|url=http://www.usatoday.com/sports/college/football/recruiting/2001-07-17-maxcol.htm|accessdate=2007-01-31}}</ref> ''Rivals.com'' rated Edwards as the #2 pro-style quarterback and #20 player overall in its rankings.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rivals100.rivals.com/viewprospect.asp?Sport=1&pr_key=1949|title=Trent Edwards Profile - Football Recruiting|publisher=Rivals100.rivals.com|date=|accessdate=2010-09-28}}</ref> He was recruited by [[University of Michigan|Michigan]], [[University of Florida|Florida]], [[University of Notre Dame|Notre Dame]] and [[University of Tennessee|Tennessee]], but ultimately chose [[Stanford University|Stanford]]. In his junior and senior seasons at Los Gatos, he led the team to two undefeated seasons and back-to-back [[Central Coast Section]] Division III championships with a combined record of 26-0. In his senior year, he completed 154 of 213 passes for 2,535 yards, 29 touchdowns, three interceptions, and was named as a National Football Foundation Hall of Fame Scholar-Athlete for Santa Clara County.
As a teenager, Edwards participated in the Armenian-American Summer Games in Northern California. Edwards's grandfather, Ben Morjig, was a co-founder of the games.<ref name="WAAA">{{cite web|title=37th Annual Armenian Summer Games|work=W.A.A.A.|year=2007|url=http://www.armeniansummergames.com/2007%20Files/News/2007%20Second%20Press%20Release.htm|pages=56–57|accessdate=2008-01-04}}</ref>
==College career== At Stanford, Edwards sat out his freshman year in 2002 so he could concentrate on his studies, and began 2003 behind starter Chris Lewis. After an impressive showing as a backup, Edwards got the start for four games, but was then sidelined with a shoulder injury for the rest of the season. In 2004, Edwards was the starter, but again suffered injuries that knocked him out of two games and kept him out of two others entirely. Edwards' best year was 2005, where he started all 11 games, completed 168 of 268 passes for 1934 yards and 17 touchdowns, leading the Cardinal to a 5-6 record.<ref name="mediaguide06">{{cite web|title=Player Bio: Trent Edwards |work=Stanford Football Media Guide |year=2006 |url=http://graphics.fansonly.com/photos/schools/stan/sports/m-footbl/auto_pdf/2006_Football_Media_Gd_37-100.pdf |pages=56–57 |accessdate=2007-01-31}}</ref>
In 2006, Edwards was the starter for the first seven games, but suffered a season-ending broken foot against [[University of Arizona|Arizona]] and relinquished the starting role to [[T.C. Ostrander]]. Despite Stanford's poor performance during his tenure as starting quarterback (the Cardinal was just 10-20 in games he started), Edwards was a highly touted quarterback prospect in the [[2007 NFL Draft]] due to his arm strength, accuracy, and intelligence. The summer before 2006, Edwards worked as a [[Synopsys]] intern. He decided to pass up a career in the [[electronic design automation]] industry for the NFL.<ref name="ScottWright">{{cite web|title=Trent Edwards Scouting Report |work=Scott Wright's NFL Draft Countdown |year=2007 |url=http://www.nfldraftcountdown.com/scoutingreports/qb/trentedwards.html |accessdate=2007-01-31}}</ref> Prior to the draft, [[Mel Kiper]] projected Edwards as the third-best [[quarterback]] in the draft, behind [[JaMarcus Russell]] and [[Brady Quinn]].<ref name="USA Today">{{cite news|work=USA Today |date=April 25, 2007 |title=Third QB? Why Not Trent Edwards? |url=http://www.usatoday.com/sports/football/draft/2007-04-25-trent-edwards_N.htm |accessdate=2007-10-09}}</ref>
==Professional career==
===Buffalo Bills=== [[File:Trent Edwards.jpg|thumb|right|Trent Edwards passes the ball in a 2007 game against the [[New York Jets]].]] Edwards was drafted by the [[Buffalo Bills]] in the third round (92nd overall) of the [[2007 NFL Draft]]. Edwards was a part of the [[Willis McGahee]] trade that sent McGahee to the [[Baltimore Ravens]] for the Ravens' third-round pick in March 2007. After the draft, [[Bill Walsh (American football coach)|Bill Walsh]], the [[NFL Hall of Fame|Hall of Fame]] head coach contacted Bills General Manager [[Marv Levy]] to express his confidence in Edwards' abilities.<ref name="espn2007">{{cite web|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/wire?section=nfl&id=3038418|publisher=ESPN|title=Rookie QB Trent Edwards gets chance to spark Bills offense in 1st start|date=September 27, 2007|accessdate=2008-02-18}}</ref>
====2007==== Edwards made his NFL debut on September 23, 2007 in the Bills' third regular season game against the [[New England Patriots]], after the Bills' starter [[J. P. Losman]] was injured in the first quarter.
In his first game, Edwards completed 10 of 20 passes for 97 yards with no touchdowns and one interception. In his first NFL start on September 30, 2007 against the [[New York Jets]], he made 22 of 28 passes for 234 yards with a touchdown and an interception, leading the Bills to their first win of the season. His first NFL touchdown was a one yard play-action pass on fourth and goal to [[Michael Gaines]]. In his second start, against the [[Dallas Cowboys]], Edwards completed 23 of 31 pass attempts for 176 yards and an interception.
During the game against the [[New York Jets]] in week 8, Edwards sprained his right wrist, and was held out of the next game, allowing Losman to reclaim the starting job. In week 13, following a string of poor performances by Losman, Bills coach [[Dick Jauron]] named Edwards the starter against the [[Washington Redskins]].<ref name=tsn>{{cite web|url=http://www.sportsnetwork.com/default.asp?c=sportsnetwork&page=/nfl/news/ABN4114579.htm|publisher=The Sports Network|title=Bills Name Edwards Starter|date=November 26, 2007|accessdate=2007-11-26}}</ref> Edwards led the Bills to a victory over the Redskins in which he led his first fourth quarter comeback, completing three passes to set up the game-winning field goal. As a result, he was named the NFL Rookie of the Week.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.buffalonews.com/sports/story/220527.html|title=Emotional rescue for Bills}}</ref> The following week against the winless [[Miami Dolphins]], he passed for 165 yards and a career high four touchdown passes to lead the Bills to a 38-17 win. Despite losing the last three games of the season, Edwards was named to the all-rookie team after the season was completed.
====2008==== During the week 5 contest against the [[Arizona Cardinals]] on October 5, Edwards suffered a concussion as a result of a hard hit by [[Adrian Wilson (American football)|Adrian Wilson]] on the third play of the game and did not return for the rest of the game. However, Edwards returned in the following game in week 7 against the [[San Diego Chargers]] and completed 25 of 30 passes in a 23-14 win. He was selected as the [[FedEx Air & Ground NFL Players of the Week|FedEx Air Player of the Week]] for his performance.
In week 13, against the [[San Francisco 49ers]], Edwards suffered a groin injury and did not return for the rest of the game. He was sidelined the following two games as a result of the injury. He returned for the final two games of the season. After a 5-1 start, the Bills missed the playoffs for the 9th straight season after losing 8 of the remaining 10 games.
====2009==== Edwards' 2009 season was further plagued by inconsistency and injuries. The Bills lost four of their first five games of the season, during which Edwards' play was noted as inconsistent, affected by poor performances by the Bills' offensive line. Within the first 5 games, Edwards was sacked 18 times. Edwards' worst performance during this time period was week 4 against the [[Miami Dolphins|Dolphins]] in which he recorded a season low [[passer rating]] of 51.0, threw for a season game-high 3 interceptions, was sacked 6 times, and recorded his only fumble of the season.
On October 18, Edwards suffered a concussion early in the second quarter against the [[New York Jets|Jets]] as a result of a hit by [[New York Jets|Jets]] [[linebackers]] [[David Harris (American football)|Harris]] and [[Calvin Pace|Pace]]. He did not return for the rest of the game, and missed the following two games. He returned after the bye week to start against the [[Tennessee Titans]], but continued to struggle, at one point missing a wide-open [[Terrell Owens|Owens]] and then throwing an interception that was returned for a touchdown.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nfl.com/gamecenter/2009111506/2009/REG10/bills@titans#tab:recap/recap-channels:cat-post-recap-full-story|publisher=NFL.com|title=Buffalo Bills at Tennessee Titans - 2009 Week 10|accessdate=2010-04-24}}</ref> He finished the game completing 18 of 28 passes for 185 yards with a touchdown and an interception, as the Bills were routed to a 41-17 loss.
Following the game against the [[Tennessee Titans|Titans]], Edwards was benched for the remaining 7 games in favor of [[Ryan Fitzpatrick]]. He did not play for the rest of the season except for making a brief appearance during the week 15 game against the [[New England Patriots]] when he spelled [[Ryan Fitzpatrick|Fitzpatrick]] in the fourth quarter. Edwards completed 1 of 2 passes for -1 yards before being carted off the field, injuring his right knee as a result of a sack by [[New England Patriots|Patriots]] defender [[Tully Banta-Cain]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nfl.com/gamecenter/2009122001/2009/REG15/patriots@bills|publisher=NFL.com|title=New England Patriots at Buffalo Bills - 2009 Week 15|accessdate=2010-04-24}}</ref>
====2010==== Edwards faced competition from quarterbacks Ryan Fitzpatrick and [[Brian Brohm]] for the Bills' starting quarterback position in [[2010 Buffalo Bills season|2010]]. Edwards won the battle and started in all four of the Bills' preseason games. In their first two games of the regular season, Edwards threw for only 152 yards combined, and the Bills lost both games. On his final play as a Bill, against [[2010 Green Bay Packers season|Green Bay]], Edwards ran out of bounds on a fourth down scramble, 7 yards short of the first down marker with 1:10 to go.
Edwards was benched the following day<ref>September 20, 2010</ref> in favor of Fitzpatrick, who would be the Bills' full-time starter for the next three seasons. The Bills waived Edwards on September 27, one day after Fitpatrick threw for 247 yards in a Week Three game against [[2010 New England Patriots season|New England]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2010/football/nfl/09/27/bills.edwards.ap/index.html?eref=sircrc|title=Buffalo Bills release QB Trent Edwards one week after benching - NFL - SI.com|publisher=Sportsillustrated.cnn.com|date=2010-09-27|accessdate=2010-09-28}}</ref>
===Jacksonville Jaguars=== Edwards was claimed off waivers by the [[Jacksonville Jaguars]] on September 28. He was the backup quarterback behind [[David Garrard]], and wore jersey #5.
Edwards made his first appearance for the Jaguars on October 18, 2010, against the Tennessee Titans on Monday Night Football, when starting quarterback David Garrard left the game after suffering a concussion.<ref>{{cite web|title=Titans vs. Jaguars - Recap |publisher=Sportsillustrated.cnn.com |year=2010 |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/football/nfl/gameflash/2010/10/18/4022_recap.html |accessdate=2010-12-21}}</ref>
===Oakland Raiders=== After becoming a free agent following the 2010 season, Edwards signed with the [[Oakland Raiders]] on July 30, 2011, and was released on September 3, during the final roster cuts.
===Philadelphia Eagles=== On February 23, 2012, Edwards signed a one-year deal with the [[Philadelphia Eagles]].
Edwards had a disappointing mini camp, and was viewed as a roster filler. However, he started to warm up in training camp, and found his opportunity in the preseason, after [[quarterback]] [[Mike Kafka]] broke his non-throwing hand at the [[Pittsburgh Steelers]]. Edwards went 54-of-80 for 489 yards, with four touchdowns and zero [[interceptions]]. The team cut Kafka on August 31, meaning Edwards had won the job as third string quarterback, after the rookie [[Nick Foles]]. Edwards was released on April 15, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|last=Rosenthal|first=Gregg|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap1000000159996/article/philadelphia-eagles-release-trent-edwards|title=Philadelphia Eagles release Trent Edwards|publisher=[[National Football League]]|date=April 15, 2013|accessdate=April 15, 2013}}</ref>
===Chicago Bears=== On August 18, 2013, Edwards was signed by the [[Chicago Bears]] for one year.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mayer|first=Larry|url=http://www.chicagobears.com/news/article-1/Bears-add-more-depth-at-quarterback-by-inking-Edwards/ed78ae5f-73d8-41a6-8a48-eb17ebc0dd56|title=Bears add more depth at quarterback by inking Edwards|publisher=[[Chicago Bears]]|date=August 18, 2013|accessdate=August 18, 2013}}</ref> Edwards had previously worked out with the Bears during the offseason.<ref>{{cite web|last=Crabtree|first=Curtis|url=http://profootballtalk.nbcsports.com/2013/06/05/bears-to-workout-trent-edwards-jordan-palmer-along-with-jamarcus-russell/|title=Bears to workout Trent Edwards, Jordan Palmer along with JaMarcus Russell|publisher=[[Profootballtalk.com]]|date=June 5, 2013|accessdate=August 18, 2013}}</ref> He was released on August 30, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mayer|first=Larry|url=http://www.chicagobears.com/news/article-1/Bears-cut-17-players-still-have-five-to-go/24b878db-ac76-463c-b766-ef4adfb0ae1c|title=Bears cut 17 players, still have five to go|publisher=[[Chicago Bears]]|date=August 30, 2013|accessdate=August 30, 2013}}</ref>
===Second Stint with Raiders=== Edwards was signed by the [[Oakland Raiders]] to a future contract on January 3, 2014.<ref>{{cite news|work=NBCSports.com|url=http://profootballtalk.nbcsports.com/2014/01/03/raiders-sign-trent-edwards-to-future-contract/|title=Raiders sign Trent Edwards to future contract|first=Curtis|last=Crabtree|date=January 3, 2014|accessdate=2014-06-15}}</ref> The Raiders released Edwards on August 26, 2014.<ref>[http://www.raiders.com/news/article-1/Raiders-Announce-Transactions/ac64c4f2-843c-4a72-b0f1-e4f3354c27c4 Raiders Announce Transactions]</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2014}} {{Use British English|date=February 2014}} The following is a list of late night, DVD and spin-off series of [[Channel 4]] [[soap-opera]] ''[[Hollyoaks]]''. Each has a brief summary of the plot. ==Video/DVD specials== ===Hollyoaks: Off on One=== A video spin-off from 1998 which sees [[Rob Hawthorne (Hollyoaks)|Rob Hawthorne]] seek revenge against [[Kurt Benson]]. The storyline comes to a dramatic conclusion with Rob and Kurt fighting on a boat. Rob rushes at Kurt, however he moves out of the way and Rob falls into the sea, with everyone believing he is dead. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Indecent Behaviour=== A video/DVD spin-off released in 2001. [[Geri Hudson]] arrives with footballer boyfriend [[Jason Cunliffe (Hollyoaks)|Jason Cunliffe]]. In a club, [[Scott Anderson (Hollyoaks)|Scott Anderson]] begins to chat Geri up. [[Luke Morgan]] steps in to stop him taking it too far, however just as Scott and his friends are about to throw Luke into the river, Scott tells his friends that he has a better idea; Scott and his friends pull Luke's trousers down to make fun of Luke's rape from the previous year. [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]] and [[Beth Morgan (Hollyoaks)|Beth Morgan]] try to break Scott and Luke up before a fight breaks, which it does between Ben and Luke. Beth is later offered a lift by Scott, and then is raped. {{-}} ==Late night specials== ===Hollyoaks: Lost Weekend=== Four episodes broadcast in 1999 centring around the kidnapping of [[Lucy Benson]] by Rob Hawthorne and the desperate search by [[Ruth Osborne]], [[Lewis Richardson (Hollyoaks)|Lewis Richardson]] and [[Tony Hutchinson]]. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Boys Do Barca=== Broadcast in 2000, [[Alex Bell (Hollyoaks)|Alex Bell]], [[Max Cunningham]], [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]], [[Tony Hutchinson]], [[Luke Morgan]], [[Sam "O.B." O'Brien]], [[Sol Patrick]] and [[Lewis Richardson (Hollyoaks)|Lewis Richardson]] make their way to [[Barcelona]] to celebrate [[Rory Finnigan]]'s stag party before Finn marries Tony's Mother. Tony, however, has secretly enlisted the help of [[Carol Groves]] to convince Finn not to go ahead with the marriage. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Breaking Boundaries=== Broadcast in March 2000, the late night special involves a 90s disco at the club where [[Ruth Osborne]] discovers [[Lewis Richardson (Hollyoaks)|Lewis Richardson's]] gambling addiction. Ruth and Lewis eventually end up sleeping together, despite Ruth's marriage to [[Kurt Benson]]. Meanwhile, after a football match, [[Mark Gibbs]] beats up [[Luke Morgan]] before raping him. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Leap of Faith=== The 2003 late night special sees [[Ellie Mills]] try to kill herself before telling serial-killer husband [[Toby Mills|Toby]] to hand himself in to the police. Toby realises he could not live without Ellie and ends up holding her hostage on a rooftop. As Toby prepares to jump with Ellie, [[Dan Hunter]] arrives and pushes Toby off the building, killing him. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: After Hours=== A four-part late night series broadcast in 2004. [[Lisa Hunter]] is whisked away to Paris with a man she meets in a hotel where she worked. [[Joe Spencer (Hollyoaks)|Joe Spencer]] and his friends go on a night out that ends in disaster. Meanwhile, former character [[Matt Musgrove]] crosses over to the special. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: In Too Deep=== In a one off special aired on 31 May 2005, [[Steph Dean]] is haunted by the ghost of one of [[Toby Mills]]' victims and she nearly drowns. Meanwhile [[Lee Hunter (Hollyoaks)|Lee Hunter]] and Bombhead cause mayhem at the backstage of Steph's show. {{-}} '''Cast:''' {| class="wikitable" |- ! Character ! Actor |- | [[Bombhead]] | [[Lee Otway]] |- | [[Cameron Clark]] | Ben Gerrard |- | [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]] | [[Marcus Patric]] |- | [[Craig Dean]] | [[Guy Burnett]] |- | [[Frankie Osborne|Frankie Dean]] | [[Helen Pearson]] |- | [[Steph Dean]] | [[Carley Stenson]] |- | [[Lee Hunter]] | [[Alex Carter (British actor)|Alex Carter]] |- | [[Lisa Hunter]] | [[Gemma Atkinson]] |- | [[Joe Spencer (Hollyoaks)|Joe Spencer]] | Matt Milburn |- | Lucy | [[Celena Cherry]] |- | Michelle | Lou Emmett |- | Simon | Sean Taylor |- | Vanessa | Lizzie Hills |} ===Hollyoaks: Crossing the Line=== The late night special broadcast in 2005 sees [[Andy Holt (Hollyoaks)|Andy Holt]] spike [[Dannii Carbone]]'s drink with [[gamma-Hydroxybutyric acid|GHB]] before raping her. Andy then reveals his activities to his friend, [[Sam Owen]], who agrees to join Andy to drug and rape girls. Meanwhile Chris tricks [[Lee Hunter (Hollyoaks)|Lee Hunter]] into sleeping with a transvestite called Aphrodite. Elsewhere, [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]] and [[Lisa Hunter]] make friends with siblings Ally and Alex. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: No Going Back======== Following ''Crossing the Line'', [[Andy Holt (Hollyoaks)|Andy]] drugs [[Sophie Burton|Sophie]] and [[Mel Burton]]. He rapes Mel and leaves [[Sam Owen|Sam]] to rape Sophie, but he does not. Dannii tells [[Russ Owen]] that she was raped. He does not believe her so she attempts suicide. Mel, Sophie and [[Louise Summers]] stop her and report Andy to the police. Sam and Andy, both on the top of a cliff, are caught in a fight between themselves and Russ. Sam and Andy both fall over the cliff. Russ manages to grab the pair, however has to let one go, so lets Andy fall to his death. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Back from the Dead=== In 2006, Andy Holt returns after surviving the fall and seeks his revenge against Russ by kidnapping his sister [[Nicole Owen|Nicole]]. Sam and Russ come in to free Nicole but Andy attacks them with a metal pole and threatens to rape Nicole but then Mel bursts in and whacks him over the head with the metal pole and begins to laugh at him as she calls the police. Whilst tied up, Andy let's slip to Russ and Nicole about Sam's involvement in the rapes. Andy escapes, and Mel chases after him and he runs into a metal spike and he starts to bleed from his mouth, he starts to talk but Mel can't understand what he said, maybe it was sorry! He then dies a painful death causing celebrations round Chester to those he raped{{-}} ===Hollyoaks: King of Hearts=== A late night special called ''Hollyoaks: King of Hearts'' was announced in November 2010 and was broadcast on 15 December 2010 on Channel 4.{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a287673/hollyoaks-confirms-late-night-special.html |title=Hollyoaks confirms late-night special |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi Médias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]) |first=Daniel |last=Kilkelly |accessdate=2010-11-14 |date=14 November 2010}} The episode followed events in the main series which saw [[Kathleen McQueen]] blackmailing her family. The episode features [[Rhys Ashworth]] and [[Jacqui McQueen]] attempting to cheat during a game of poker with [[Brendan Brady]] and [[Danny Houston]]. After their plan is discovered, Danny tells Jacqui she must sleep with him to save Rhys and wipe the debt they owe him. The episode was originally due to air on 16 December 2010. However, this was later changed.{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/scoop/a289629/schedule-change-for-hollyoaks-special.html |title=Schedule change for Hollyoaks special |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi Médias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]) |first=Daniel |last=Kilkelly |date=24 November |accessdate=2010-11-24}} {{-}} ==Spin-off series== ===Hollyoaks: Movin' On=== A new sixteen part series. [[Tony Hutchinson]] and [[Rory Finnigan]] open their new business venture. Meanwhile, after beating [[Ruth Osborne]] up, [[Lewis Richardson (Hollyoaks)|Lewis]], racked by guilt, commits suicide. Ruth then leaves for [[London]]. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Let Loose=== A 2005 series following [[Ben Davies (Hollyoaks)|Ben Davies]] and [[Lisa Hunter]] as they depart Hollyoaks for a new life. Lisa and Ben's relationship is put to the test over Lisa's jealousy, however she agrees to give their relationship another go. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: In the City=== {{main|Hollyoaks: In the City}} Lisa and Ben return to [[Liverpool]], where Lisa is set up with a modelling agency. Ben spends the pair's entire savings on a bar. Lisa delves further up the career path and Ben has an illicit affair and is involved in dodgy dealings with Burton Phillips. Finally, Lisa ended up shooting and killing Ben. ===Hollyoaks Later=== {{main|Hollyoaks Later}} {{main|Hollyoaks Later (series 1)}} 2008 series following [[Niall Rafferty]] as he returns for revenge on [[Steph Cunningham]], [[Craig Dean]] and [[Tom Cunningham]], which leads to the dramatic death of Niall. Meanwhile [[Kris Fisher|Kris]] and [[Malachy Fisher]] return to Ireland to attend their father's funeral as Malachy and [[Mercedes McQueen]] marry. [[Sarah Barnes]], [[Nancy Hayton]] and [[Zoe Carpenter]] head off on a "girly" road trip as the Dirty Diegos enter 'Battle of the Bands'.{{ cite news | url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a134073/late-night-hollyoaks-to-get-c4-run.html | title='Late Night Hollyoaks' to get C4 run | first=Kris |last=Green | publisher=[[Digital Spy]] | date=30 October 2008 | accessdate=2008-10-30 }} {{main|Hollyoaks Later (series 2)}} A second series was commissioned and was broadcast in September 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/H/hollyoaks/news/previous/09/07/090702.html |title=Hollyoaks Later To Return |publisher=Channel 4 |date=2 July 2009 |accessdate=2009-07-03}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{ cite news| url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a153128/kirkwood-to-head-up-new-hollyoaks-later.html| title=Kirkwood to produce new Hollyoaks Later | publisher=Digital Spy |first=Kris |last=Green| date=17 April 2009 | accessdate=2009-04-17 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/H/hollyoaks/news/previous/09/04/090417pm.html |title=Hollyoaks Later returns! |publisher=Channel4 |date=17 April 2009 |accessdate=2009-07-03}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} It follows four main stories: [[Hannah Ashworth|Hannah]], [[Rhys Ashworth|Rhys]] and [[Josh Ashworth]] go off to a music festival, where they encounter a dangerous drug dealer, [[Tony Hutchinson]] marries [[Cindy Cunningham]] after several mishaps, [[McQueen family|the McQueens]] go to London for [[Theresa McQueen|Theresa's]] modelling and [[Sarah Barnes]] and [[Zoe Carpenter]] are joined by Sarah's jealous girlfriend [[Lydia Hart]] on a parachute jump which leads to Sarah's death after Lydia sabotages her parachute. {{main|Hollyoaks Later (series 3)}} In April 2010, Channel 4 announced that the show would return for a third series, this time produced by Hollyoaks series producer Paul Marquess. The characters appearing included: [[Mitzeee Minniver]], [[Carl Costello]], [[Riley Costello]], [[Seth Costello]], [[Malachy Fisher]], [[Mercedes Fisher]], [[Theresa McQueen]] and [[Nancy Hayton]]. Filming took place in the summer of 2010, and in October 2010, it was revealed that the third series would begin on 25 October, and would closely interweave with the main Hollyoaks series, revolving around "one fateful night". UFC Fighter Michael Bisping guest starred. {{main|Hollyoaks Later (series 4)}} It Was reported that a fourth series had been recommissioned due to the popularity of the last few series. Filming will take place in the summer of 2011. Characters rumoured to be involved in the storylines have included [[Mercedes McQueen]], [[Myra McQueen]], [[Michaela McQueen]], [[Texas Longford]], [[Silas Blissett]], [[Heidi Costello]], [[Riley Costello]], [[Lynsey Nolan]] and [[Mitzeee Minniver]]. New cast members include a new addition to the McQueen family played by Amy Walsh sister of Girls aloud star Kimberly Walsh and a new unnamed hunk to be played by ex-eastenders actor Chris Coghill. By early June scenes had begun filming in Ibiza with Mercedes McQueen, Myra McQueen, Michaela McQueen, [[Theresa McQueen]], [[Will Savage]], [[Rae Wilson]] and Mitzeee Minniver. Series 4 is set to be aired over the course of five nights from 5 September to 10 September 2011. In the gripping final episode of the series, Rae Wilson was strangled by Silas Blissett after he heard that [[Brendan Brady]] wanted to kill her. He wanted Brendan to be arrested on suspicion of murder so that he could continue with his evil plans. {{-}} ==Online spin-offs== ===Hollyoaks: The Morning After the Night Before=== {{main|Hollyoaks: The Morning After the Night Before}} [[Josh Ashworth]] heads off to party with [[Dave Colburn]] in [[Manchester]] in the on-line spin-off which features the down side to [[binge drinking]].{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a159587/online-oaks-to-explore-binge-drinking.html |title=Online 'Oaks to explore binge drinking |publisher=Digital Spy|first=Kris|last=Green |date=12 June 2009|accessdate=2009-11-09}}{{cite news|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/H/hollyoaks/news/previous/09/06/090608.html |title=Hollyoaks: The Morning After the Night Before |publisher=Channel 4 |date=8 June 2009|accessdate=2009-11-09}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} ===Hollyoaks: Freshers=== Freshers is an 2010 online drama following the lives of the fresher students before they begin at Hollyoaks Community College. Like ''The Morning After the Night Before'', several characters' social networking websites were created. This time using [[Facebook]]. The series featured the return of [[Lee Hunter]], and debut of new characters [[Jamil Fadel]], [[Leanne Holiday]] and [[Doug Carter]]. It also starred [[Charlotte Lau]], [[India Longford]], [[Texas Longford]] and [[Dave Colburn]]. A return also featured [[David "Bombhead" Burke|Bombhead]]. ==Media Content== ===Hollyoaks: Access All Areas=== {{-}} ===Hollyoaks on the Pull=== {{-}} ===Hollyoaks: Extreme Challenges=== {{-}} ===Hollyoaks Backstage=== An on-line documentary featuring various members of the ''Hollyoaks'' cast showing viewers behind the scenes of the show. Each 3 minute episode is shown broadcast weekly on the E4 website. {{-}} ===''The Hollyoaks Music Show''=== {{Infobox television | show_name = The Hollyoaks Music Show | italic_title = no | format = [[Music]] | language = English | num_episodes = 26 | presenter = [[Rick Edwards]] (2008–2010)
[[Matt Littler]] (2011) | producer = Sarah Clarke | director = Chris Howe
Dave Skinner | company = Conker Media
[[Lime Pictures]] | runtime = 30 minutes | website = http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/ | production_website =http://www.limepictures.com/MusicShow.htm }} '''''The Hollyoaks Music Show''''' is a music television programme broadcast as part of [[T4 (Channel 4)|T4]] on [[Channel 4]]. The show began broadcasting on 17 October 2009, following a pilot episode in 2008, and features various recording artists performing and participating in the show. It is sponsored by British retailer [[Matalan]] and hosted by [[Rick Edwards]]. The series first began in 2008, when it was named ''Hollyoaks Music Special'', a one-off programme hosted by [[Rick Edwards]] and former ''Hollyoaks'' actor [[Matt Littler]].{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a91635/hollyoaks-to-host-music-special.html |title='Hollyoaks' to host 'Music Special' |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi Médias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]) |first=Dave |last=West |date=15 March 2008 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} Following its success, Channel 4 commissioned two series{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a96807/c4-wants-hollyoaks-music-show-series.html |title=C4 wants 'Hollyoaks Music Show' series |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi Médias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]) |first=Dave |last=West |date=15 March 2008 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} and retailer [[Matalan]] became the show's official sponsor, in order to reach the target audience of 16 to 34 year olds. Repeats of the series have been shown on [[4Music]] since 2010.{{cite web |url=http://www.4music.com/article/ontv/the-hollyoaks-music-show-2010-06-05.html |title=The Hollyoaks Music Show |date=31 May 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20 |work=[[4Music]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]])}} In 2009 the first series aired, retitled ''The Hollyoaks Music Show''. When the new series was broadcast, it was shown as part of T4 weekly on Channel 4, again presented by Rick Edwards. It is filmed within the ''Hollyoaks'' studios in [[Childwall]], [[Liverpool]]. The show features signed and unsigned acts performing in and around the ''Hollyoaks'' set. A Christmas special was announced in November 2010, due to air in December.{{cite web |url=http://www.e4.com/blog/hollyoaks/post/ajeki0bif2jxepkisgcz9n/view.e4 |title=Music Show with Matalan.co.uk - Xmas Special |work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |first=Ciaran |last=Varley |date=23 November 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-24}} Acts which have appeared include [[The Saturdays]],{{cite web|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/interviews/thesaturdays.html|title=Saturdays To Disband For S Club Juniors Reunion?|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |date=20 October 2009|accessdate=2009-10-20}} [[Mr Hudson]],{{cite web|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/interviews/mrhudson.html|title=Mr Hudson Was Laughed At By Rihanna Shocker...|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |date=20 October 2009|accessdate=2009-10-20}} [[Chipmunk (rapper)|Chipmunk]],{{cite web|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/interviews/chipmunk.html|title=Chipmunk's Critical Thinking...|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |date=20 October 2009|accessdate=2009-10-20}} [[Tinchy Stryder]], [[N-Dubz]] and [[Calvin Harris]], [[Example (rapper)|Example]], [[Jason Derulo]],{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/blog/week07/index.shtml |title=Show Seven: Riding Solo |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |year=2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} [[Diana Vickers]], [[Olly Murs]], [[The Wanted]] and [[You Me at Six]] as well as some unsigned acts including Minnie Londoner{{cite web |url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/enter/ |title=Holypops - The Hollyoaks Music Show |work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |year=2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} and The Palpitations.{{cite web |url=http://www.thepalpitations.co.uk/hollyoaks-music/ |title=Hollyoaks Music |work=The Palpitations |publisher=(thepalpitations.co.uk) |date=24 May 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} The show regularly features members of the ''Hollyoaks'' cast as part of the audience.{{cite web|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/about.html|title=About The Hollyoaks Music Show|work=[[E4 (channel)|E4]] |publisher=([[Channel 4 Television Corporation]]) |date=20 October 2009|accessdate=2009-10-20}} Along with the performances, ''The Hollyoaks Music Show'' also features fashion awards in each episode from episode 11 onwards. The award is presented to an act from the same episode for their clothing style. Acts who won the award include Olly Murs, [[Rihanna]], [[Selena Gomez]], [[McFly]] and [[JLS]].{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/fashionaward/ |title=This Week's Fashion Award |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |date=11 June 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} A competition was run online throughout the series, with the winner given the chance to appear performing in an episode of ''Hollyoaks''.{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/hollypops/ |title=Hollypops |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |year= 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} The winner was Shide Boss.{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/hollypops/week04/ |title=Show Four - Shide Boss |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |date=12 June 2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}}{{cite web |url=http://www.matalan-hollyoaksmusicshow.co.uk/exclusivevideo/ |title=Exclusive: Shide Boss on set |work=The Hollyoaks Music Show |publisher=([[Matalan]]) |year=2010 |accessdate=2010-11-20}} {{-}} ==Other related shows== ===Hollyoaks: The Good, the Bad and the Gorgeous=== A drama-documentary shown on [[E4 (channel)|E4]] on 2 October 2009.{{cite news|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/H/hollyoaks/news/previous/09/09/090914.html|title=Hollyoaks: The Good, the Bad and the Gorgeous|publisher=Channel 4|date=14 September 2009|accessdate=2009-09-14}} [[Ste Hay]] and [[Cheryl Brady]] go to a cinema where old clips from ''Hollyoaks'' are being shown by a familiar face. It was presented by Bernard Latham who played [[Gordon Cunningham]]. For the episode, special sequences were filmed between old clips of the show. They parodied such films as [[Stanley Kubrick]]'s ''[[The Shining (film)|The Shining]]'' and [[Randal Kleiser]]'s ''[[Grease (film)|Grease]]''. {{-}} ===Hollyoaks Best Bits 2011=== ===Hollyoaks: A Little Film About Love=== A special [[E4 (TV channel)|E4]] only episode which aired on 11 November 2011 following characters [[Jason Costello]] and [[Bart McQueen]] travelling to London to stop [[Sinead O'Connor (Hollyoaks)|Sinead O'Connor]] from leaving with boyfriend [[Gaz Bennett]], during the journey Jason records on a camera as documentary, it also features pre-recorded clips of Jason interviewing characters such as [[Maddie Morrison]], [[Neil Cooper (Hollyoaks)|Neil Cooper]] and [[Lynsey Nolan]]. It also features [[Jono (Hollyoaks)|Jono]], [[Nancy Hayton]], [[Tilly Evans]], [[Scott Sabeka]], [[Darren Osborne]], [[Duncan Button]] and [[Diane O'Connor]].http://www.digitalspy.ie/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/spoilers/a348178/a-little-film-about-love-by-jason-costello.html ===Hollyoaks: Chasing Rainbows=== A Special E4 only episode which aired on 7 June 2012, that follows [[Dennis Savage]] on his journey with students [[Leanne Holiday]], [[Barney Harper-McBride]] and [[Scott Sabeka]] who travel to Liverpool to seek out musician [[Maverick Sabre]] to headline the Savage's Forest Party back in the village, Dennis struggles to prove throughout that he knows Maverick and will be able to find him in time for the party.http://www.digitalspy.ie/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/spoilers/a382560/chasing-rainbows.html ===Tom's Life=== ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/index.html The official ''Hollyoaks'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/the-morning-after-the-night-before/ The official ''Hollyoaks: The Morning After the Night Before'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/tgtbtg/index.html The official ''Hollyoaks: The Good, the Bad and the Gorgeous'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/later/2009/ The official ''Hollyoaks Later'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/hollyoaksmusicshowwithmatalan/ The official ''Hollyoaks Music Show'' website] * [http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/freshers/index.html The official ''Hollyoaks Freshers'' website] {{Hollyoaks}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''Hollyoaks'' spin-offs}} {{DEFAULTSORT:List Of Hollyoaks Spin-Offs}} [[Category:Lists of soap opera episodes|Hollyoaks]] [[Category:Hollyoaks spin-offs]]

revision.comment: Added fields to thepeerage.com citations -- it is not a [[WP:SOURCE|reliable source]]) and other fixes, replaced: *[http://www.thepeerage.com/ www.thepeerage.com] → *{{cite web |last=Lundy |first=Darryl |url=http://www.th using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
The '''Bridges Baronetcy''', of Goodnestone in the County of Kent, was created in the [[Baronetage of Great Britain]] on 19 April 1718 for Brook Bridges. His son the second Baronet, died in 1733 whilst in office as [[High Sheriff of Kent]]. His grandson, the third Baronet, represented [[Kent (UK Parliament constituency)|Kent]] in the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]]. In 1842, the fifth Baronet (the grandson of the third Baronet), unsuccessfully claimed the ancient [[Baron FitzWalter|barony of FitzWalter]] (which had been in [[abeyance]] since 1756) as a descendant of Mary, sister of the seventeenth Baron FitzWalter. He later sat as a [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Kent East (UK Parliament constituency)|Kent East]]. In 1868 he was created '''Baron FitzWalter''', of Woodham Walter in the County of Essex, in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. However, the peerage became extinct on his death, while he was succeeded in the baronetcy by his younger brother, the sixth Baronet. On his death the title passed to his first cousin, the seventh Baronet. He was the son of Reverend Brook Henry Bridges, third son of the third Baronet. When he died this line of the family also failed and the title was passed on to his first cousin, the eighth Baronet. He was the son of Reverend Brook Edward Bridges, fourth son of the third Baronet. He never married and on his death in 1899 the baronetcy became extinct.
The seat of the Bridges family was [[Goodnestone, Dover|Goodnestone Park]] in [[Kent]]. The house was built in 1704 by the first Bridges Baronet. After the death of the last Baronet in 1899 the house came into the Plumptre family through the marriage of Eleanor Bridges, daughter of the fourth Bridges Baronet, to Reverend Henry Western Plumptre. In 1924 the abeyance of the barony of FitzWalter was terminated in favour of the latter's grandson, John Bridges Plumptre.
==Bridges baronets, of Goodneston (1718)== *Sir [[Brook Bridges, 1st Baronet]] (1679–1728) *Sir [[Brook Bridges, 2nd Baronet]] (1709–1733) *[[Sir Brook Bridges, 3rd Baronet|Sir Brook William Bridges, 3rd Baronet]] (1733–1791) *Sir Brook William Bridges, 4th Baronet (1767–1829) *[[Brook Bridges, 1st Baron FitzWalter|Sir Brook William Bridges, 5th Baronet]] (1801–1875) (created '''Baron FitzWalter''' in 1868)
==Barons FitzWalter (1868)== *[[Brook William Bridges, 1st Baron FitzWalter]] (1801–1875)
==Bridges baronets, of Goodneston (1718; Reverted)== *Sir Brook George Bridges, 6th Baronet (1802–1890) *Sir Thomas Pym Bridges, 7th Baronet (1805–1895) *Sir George Talbot Bridges, 8th Baronet (1818–1899)
==See also== *[[Baron FitzWalter]]
==External links== *[http://www.goodnestoneparkgardens.co.uk/ Goodnestone Park]
==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990. *[http://www.leighrayment.com/Baronetage.htm Leigh Rayment' s baronetage page] *{{cite web |last=Lundy |first=Darryl |url=http://www.thepeerage.com/info.htm |title=FAQ |publisher=[http://www.thepeerage.com The Peerage]}}{{Verify credibility|failed=y |date=February 2013}}<!--Lundy is not a reliable source so cite Lundy's reliable source See [[WP:SAYWHEREYOUREADIT]]-->
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bridges}} [[Category:Baronetcies]] [[Category:Extinct baronetcies]]
